page.title: 08Ivy House Farm: Pateley
page.content: Farming is one of the main industries in this area. It consists mainly of the rearing of beef cattle and sheep, as there is now very little dairy farming being done. The area produces very hardy stock, as all animals graze on land more than 500 feet above sea level. Ivy Farm near Pateley has cows, calves, sheep and two geese. It is two hundred and ten acres in size. The life of the farmer's wife at Ivy Farm is a busy one, preparing food for meals and doing all of the bookkeeping and V.A.T.for the farm. She also does all the shopping in Ripon every two weeks. Every morning, she feeds the farm dogs. She always answers the phone and gets parts for the farm machinery. She does not work in the fields, but does help with lambing in the spring.
